title: Great Way to do Therapy!
review:
I have used this app several times and I love it! I like that you can message a therapist (you match with one) anytime and they do see the message when they work.  They respond and you can go from there.

You can also switch therapists too if you don‚Äôt like how therapy is going with your current therapist.

For me this works the best and you pay once a month instead of weekly. 

It helps me and I like it, it helps me and I get a better understanding of what I am going through.

I would recommend this app to anyone who is looking for therapy, try online therapy and try Talkspace.

title: Amazing
review: Just amazing. It almost feels MORE personal being able to communicate in the MOMENT that you feel it.  To chat multiple times a day. To take time to digest your feelings to record or type them helps to formalize them ina way that is almost more resolute and helpful. Very interesting!

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time or money
review: The app sounds good in concept, but in reality I found it useless. They make you pay for a month at a time with no guarantee your therapist will respond to you. My therapist was super pushy about doing a video call. She asked good questions but never helped me work through my problems. I finally just asked point blank for suggestions for my anxiety and was ghosted. Save your time, save your money, look into therapists that work near you instead of wasting your time to end up disappointed.
developerResponse: {'id': 23685044, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for taking the time to write this review. We would love to look into this right away. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. We look forward to helping you.', 'modified': '2021-06-30T22:26:02Z'}

title: Therapists are sales reps
review:
If you‚Äôve ever worked in sales you will recognize they use every trick in the book to get you to sign up. It seems pretty unethical for licensed therapists to be so manipulative to make a buck.

After determining they don‚Äôt take my insurance (or any insurance it seems, save for one plan), I wanted to forget my experience. And yet no one can tell me how to delete my account - and yes, Talkspace, there is a difference between deleting an account and canceling a non-existent subscription.

Their emails don‚Äôt even allow you to unsubscribe - the word ‚Äúunsubscribe‚Äù is there but it‚Äôs not hyperlinked. Ever heard of the CAN-SPAM Act? Though given your blatant disregard for ethics I guess I shouldn‚Äôt be surprised you don‚Äôt care about the law. 

Do not waste your time with this app and whatever you do, do not enter any of your personal data into it.

Gross.

title: Health Tech with no Human Care
review: Absolutely zero customer service. Providers are allowed to cancel on you last minute multiple times. Providers have even communicated that they can‚Äôt figure out the app or have even said they are quitting. And there is nobody to actually help with that, instead it‚Äôs just blamed on not finding the ‚Äúright match.‚Äù You can go months without having an actual appointment - this is just another health tech company that ignores the need for human care. You‚Äôre better off somewhere else.

title: Taking advantage of people who need help
review: Talkspace preys on people seeking help for their mental health and then IGNORES them. Review after review details the same experience I just had. I paid up front and received ZERO help. I was offered a ‚Äúrefund‚Äù for less than what I paid, with the disclaimer that if I ‚Äúwaived‚Äù it I would not be entitled to any refund. So I threw away about $50 on absolutely nothing. This is an excellent business model if you have no conscious. Unfortunately I trusted that a mental health app that is so well known would be competent and caring, Talkspace is not.

title: So disappointed
review: I am so disappointed in Talk Space. The therapists are horrible.  They did not seem to read our last correspondence and kept asking the same questions over and over. Gave literally no advice. The communication is maybe one sentence, once a day. It made things worse for me. Instead of helping me, they made me feel bad and told me to figure out ways to fix the things that were wrong with me. I just can‚Äôt believe that this service is even legal. It should be reported to the BBB.

title: Incompetent & criminal
review: I cannot adequately express how incompetent & likely criminal the Talkspace service is. It‚Äôs been suggested that their therapy providers are not licensed professionals, but customer service agents, and this is completely consistent with my experience. They offer little more than bots trying to sell subscriptions. I contacted customer support about unacceptable therapist behavior and a refund over two weeks ago, and I have never received any reply. This service is a scam, preys on the vulnerable & should not be allowed to operate.

title: TalkSpace is a wonderful, powerful app
review: TalkSpace facilitating therapeutic connection during unfathomable COVID is priceless. I cannot think of any better thing that has happened during the pandemic. title: Charging my card w/ no service
review:
I have left a voicemail with talk space and have not heard back yet. It has been almost a week.

I signed up because I needed help. It took a very long time to get through the insane process to get connected with a doctor. I needed a psychiatrist but I was signed up through the psychology side of things. They charged me for that, then I switched to psychiatry and found out they do not treat ADD, which is what I told my ‚Äúsign up helper‚Äù from the very beginning. I told her never mind and that they couldn‚Äôt help me.
Now I‚Äôve been charged $700 with absolutely no follow up from them as to why I haven‚Äôt used the service. 

Be very careful with this app. They will take your money and not help you.
I am assuming the people that help you sign up make bonuses for how many people they can pull in.

review:
I think talk space is a little hard to get into and involved in. It is certainly not a Way that I did therapy 40 years ago. Not everyone is tech savvy and I think that creates uneasiness for some of us.

title: Frustrating
review:
Went through two therapists who took days to respond and cancelled my video sessions. Don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôre giving the therapists too many clients or what.  I had to quit my subscription early since I didn‚Äôt want to get frustrated by a third therapist in just a months time.
They keep trying to give you discounts to continue, but it doesn‚Äôt seem they‚Äôre addressing the problem of either flaky or overworked therapists.

title: Made me feel worse
review: My experience of this app has been terrible. After messaging me once to get to know me my therapist ignored me for a week and missed our video appointment. I was then put with a matching agent and then ignored for days at a time again still with no therapist. I had to talk about things that are really hard for me to these people and it‚Äôs like they didn‚Äôt care at all. I see all of these great reviews and I‚Äôm sad because im so happy it‚Äôs working great for some people, but my experience was the opposite.

title: Let down
review: Biggest waste of time. Don‚Äôt bother signing up if you are looking for a therapy solution, they guarantee responses but You‚Äôll go days without a reply which is frustrating especially when they set expectations and do not meet them. The counselors must be overwhelmed because even when they do respond their replies are short, and unproductive. So you‚Äôll go another few days without any real assistance. I‚Äôm extremely frustrated and if anything this has only made me loose faith in mental healthcare

title: Not worth the price or time
review:
I tried this once got frustrated then they offered a discount. So I tried the service again.

It‚Äôs  just to limiting. Despite the promise of responsiveness, you get 1 to 2 responses a day 4 maybe 5 days a week. Imagine having a half hour conversation over 30 days. I don‚Äôt have that kind of patients. And that rate is very expensive. It‚Äôs cheaper to speak to a provider directly. I don‚Äôt recommend this service.

We would be happy to do what we can to ensure a positive experience for you and trust in your therapist and their qualifications. Please send us an email at Feedback@talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-10-27T14:14:18Z'}

title: High cost/minimal help
review: While the idea of being able to talk with a therapist whenever you‚Äôd like throughout the day is great, it‚Äôs equally as frustrating to not get a response back for numerous hours and sometimes days later. For those that are struggling with mental health and need someone to talk to the pricing of Talkspace is too high without having insurance. The cost of $260 a month is only $15 less than my monthly car payment. There should be sliding fees or options for those that don‚Äôt have insurance.

Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com and someone from our team will get back to you within one business day. ', 'modified': '2021-01-26T02:17:31Z'}

title: Waste of money and time.
review: I paid for six months. Spend about two trying to find a decent provider. Some don‚Äôt responded some seem like the are not actually therapist. Then when I did find some one to work with. They could keep appointments and wasted the money I paid for video sessions by skipping them. Everything I ‚Äúlearned‚Äù in the last six months I could have picked up by reading basic books on my condition. I want my money, time, and trust back. Screw these rip off artist. Save

title: Waste of money and a scam
review: So disappointing, I wanted to like the app and thought it would make therapy easier to access but it‚Äôs been impossible to book anything for months and I‚Äôve wasted a ton of money trying to find someone who was qualified and didn‚Äôt talk about religion when I never mentioned it. Very very discounted. The subscription model is set up to scam you so whether or not the therapist can book or replies you‚Äôre paying Talkspace. I‚Äôve wasted an incredible amount of money,I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS APP!

title: Absolute scam!! Avoid!
review:
There are media reports of this company telling their own employees to leave positive reviews to boost its rating in the App Store.

The service is aweful.

The first therapist never responded to my messages. Not even once.

The second therapist attempted to get me to pay her directly (outside of Talkspace) and wouldn‚Äôt talk to me through the app.

Talkspace customer support is useless. They just tell you to ‚Äúkeep trying new therapists‚Äù. But every therapist I matched with was either never online or tried to scam additional money out of me.

I thought maybe this would be a cool way to relive some ‚Äúpandemic blues‚Äù I‚Äôve been feeling. But instead I just got ripped off by Talkspace.

Do your research. Many of the positive reviews on here are fake (google it).

Total scammers.

One therapist even refereed to telehealth as ‚Äúnot real therapy‚Äù.

Wow.

Not everyone fits some predetermined mold, you think that a mental health service would understand that!

title: Ripoff!!!!
review:
These are the worst! They took my money, limited choice of unqualified ‚Äúsocial workers ‚Äú
Purchased video sessions, wasted time with a guy and after a week and a half said I wanted video session he said he doesn‚Äôt do them because of COVID and his kids are home???? 
Perhaps he shouldn‚Äôt have been on the list of matches!?!?!
And then!!! Charge me $316 after all of this and after I put my account on hold because of what happened!!!!
I‚Äôm calling every news outlet possible and expose this major league scam!!

title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot?
review:
When signing up, you speak with an intake specialist, many responses back and forth but overall I don‚Äôt understand how this app works. 

 I thought I sent an opening text to a therapist but I didn‚Äôt hit ‚Äúreply‚Äù after I thought I sent a reply by hitting enter? Confusing.

 So a text from early this morning will get a response by late this evening but I only did a greeting type opening text, was I to pour out my thoughts blindly then wait for a response? I feel like I‚Äôve been ripped off.

title: Grateful
review: I‚Äôve been with TalkSpace since February 2020. I love it. I look forward to waking up now and it‚Äôs not just my coffee. I rise, grab a cup of said coffee, go outside on my deck and start my day with Tibetan singing bowls and a solid session of meditation. Self care is everything and TalkSpace gave me the permission I somehow needed. Thank you.

title: Useless
review: I‚Äôd give it zero stars but that option isn‚Äôt available. I downloaded this through my job. My first therapist I sent a message to and got a response back a day and a half later stating that they were leaving the app. I chose another therapist and it has been 2 days and still no response. What‚Äôs the point of having someone to talk to on here if nobody will respond to you? And yes they were showing as available and working that day. DELETED, such a waste of space.

My account unfroze, I was charged a full month, and my therapist told me she could no longer work with me because she wasn‚Äôt licensed in my new state.  I then cancelled my account and have emailed Talkspace twice to get a credit for the month I was charged, no response to my emails and there is no phone number to call.  Very annoying.

Can‚Äôt view subscription info, error when trying to access plan info, content doesn‚Äôt load when you first open the app, I have to use a web browser to make any settings updates and then they aren‚Äôt live in the app. Really killing the whole convenient therapy vibe.

Maybe I'll give the app another try down the line. Clearly some kinks need to be worked out. Considering the time we were all in, it was way too expensive. Not worth the money at all. I see a therapist via zoom for an hr and she only charges $75 and writes down notes for me. Way better than what talkspace offers

review:

Your other update took away the option of notifications that were set up to get alerts when my therapist is waiting or opened a call. 1 step forward and 14 steps backward. If I didn't like my therapist so much I'd have left this app 2.5 years ago.

review: Starting at $260 per month and you call that affordable? I‚Äôm sorry, and I‚Äôm aware that therapists are expensive, but they SHOULDN'T be. You‚Äôre just as much a part of the problem with today‚Äôs healthcare as everyone else. 78% of American workers live paycheck to paycheck. That means 78% of American workers don‚Äôt HAVE an extra $300 lying around. üôÑ Your ads definitely need to be rewritten, or at least pick up a dictionary to see the definition of ‚Äúaffordable.‚Äù

review: I have used a lot of apps. This app and service is really not great. My experience is that I signed up, filled out a form, was matched with a profiler, who then asked me to fill out another form ... and then another form ... and then another form and then was silent.  I am not sure of how the service actually works however I am deeply concerned that I made 4 attempts to engage, handed over a ton of very personal data and there has been absolutely no benefit from this.

Then along the way a day is skipped then two or three days and maybe you get a messages like I will respond by end of day and two days later you are still waiting. By the end of the week you have gotten one good response if you are lucky. I am disappointed. Maybe others have better luck. I did not.

title: DON‚ÄôT BUY 6 MONTHS AT ONCE
review:
I can‚Äôt‚Äô speak for the other text therapy apps out there but Talkspace IS NOT IT. 

The Good: 
- It‚Äôs on demand
- It‚Äôs easy to use (you can reply about how you‚Äôre feeling at any time like you‚Äôre texting to a friend) 
- good rates for 6 months of ‚Äú1 text message a day‚Äù 

The Bad:
- You can only view your therapist matches *ONCE* before they are gone forever. 
- If you don‚Äôt choose a therapist and stick with them forever you‚Äôll be relegated to the ‚ÄúAt this time we do not/may not have another match readily available...‚Äù
- therapist profile stated over 20+ years of experience but they could only suggest journaling as a way to heal. 
- My net utility would have been higher spending they money on 6 months of this therapy on hobby/sports equipment instead.

The service is not cheap either - I was forced to buy 1 month upfront which $236 including insurance and discounts. It would be over $300 monthly thereafter. 

The app itself and the idea itself is great ‚Äî but the slow replies or no replies from the doctors is what kills this service. I am extremely disappointed.

title: Decent app
review: It‚Äôs good concept. I like not having to go to the office. I prefer the typing as it makes me more honest. It feels easier because you are sort of anonymous and I don‚Äôt feel judged because I am not in the therapist view. You can change therapist if the one you choose is not a fit. I just don‚Äôt know how to break up with anyone.

title: Think twice, then again!!
review: As expensive as it is they should have better customer service to address the concerns of consumers. Don‚Äôt blame the pandemic for poor business practices. If I were you I‚Äôd think long and hard about spending you hard earned money with them. If you have another alternative I‚Äôd stick with them and bypass this app altogether unless you have money to waste. If zero stars were a thing they would lead the pack.

title: No therapist available after they billed me for a month
review: After taking my initial monthly payment I was matched with a therapist, provided her a detailed and personal statement of my history and goals. She responded to tell me she wasn‚Äôt accepting new patients. I have attempted numerous times to change therapists and have been unsuccessful. I messaged customer service but it could take week to hear back. A week costs $99. Waste of money, time, and energy.
developerResponse: {'id': 16028827, 'body': 'Oh no! We are very sorry to hear that you are having some trouble switching your therapist. We would be very happy to assist you. If this has not already been handled then please reach out to us at Feedback@talkspace.com so we can escalate your request. ', 'modified': '2020-06-16T20:28:51Z'}

title: Alberto is great!
review: I recommend investing in mental health at some point when it is appropriate for anyone. I ran into an issue with the subscription but the team was prompt & I think the way they handle support issues is advanced. Thank you!

title: Does not spark joy
review: Ridiculously overpriced I paid $216 (with insurance coverage) for the month and only got one 10 minute live session. The rest was chat option only. I need to verbally talk to someone otherwise I‚Äôd just text my friends. Normally I pay $20-$40 a sessions for an actual in person 45-1hr session. The one silver lining is that hopefully these apps open up more accessible and affordable mental health care üò¢ also my therapist was great it‚Äôs the price I take issue with.
developerResponse: {'id': 17833119, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for writing a review and our apologies that you did not have the best experience with us. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com, we hope to hear from you!", 'modified': '2020-09-11T21:21:37Z'}

title: Not recommended
review: Easy to sign up. They take you‚Äôre credit card info right away. Took awhile to get set up and started with therapy. We had several issues arise that were unresolved.  Customer service was very slow to respond. I cancelled the subscription and only received a portion of the fee as a refund. Extremely disappointed with this app. It had good reviews but I would not recommend it at all.
developerResponse: {'id': 16126287, 'body': 'Hi there, we are very sorry to hear that you had a disappointing experience. We would love to make it up to you, please reach out to us at Feedback@talkspace.com so we can look into it further. ', 'modified': '2020-06-21T20:26:25Z'}

title: Horrible customer service
review:
We‚Äôve had a horrible customer service experience that is several months in the works and still unresolved.

After many attempts to find an appropriate therapist, we had to give up. However, when we asked for refund or at least a prorated refund, the customer service folks kept saying the were overwhelmed with support requests.

It‚Äôs a lie.

They are quick to take your money and extremely slow and full of excuses when you request a refund. This is one of the worst and slowest customer service responses I‚Äôve experienced. These guys make United Airlines, Comcast, and the Post Office look amazing in customer service because Talkspace has set a new all-time LOW in customer service.

Buyer beware.

review: M Each time you go to edit some text the writing bar will go straight back to the end of the text. So if you want to edit something at the beginning of what you wrote you‚Äôre pretty  screwed having to constantly place the letter bar where you want it. Also getting a ‚Äònew‚Äô therapist match is far harder than talk space makes it out to be. Completly dissatified with how their searches are conducted.

title: Waste of time
review: Customer service matching agent was asking all these personal questions, when they‚Äôre not my therapist. I don‚Äôt feel comfortable talking about my problems with a random agent, certified or not. This ‚Äúmatching‚Äù thing is ridiculous, you should be able to pick a therapist based off their profile and availability. title: Ehh
review: I don‚Äôt hate the app- I think it‚Äôs beneficial. But, I don‚Äôt like that it asks for your age. I do not think that your age should be asked. Perhaps it‚Äôs just a personal feeling, but I do not like giving out my age. It‚Äôs personal. For the name thing, you can just use a random name, but I do not like the age thing. Just a personal opinion, feel free to agree or disagree.

title: Maybe they are REALLY backed up right now???
review:
No response at all from any therapist???
days now, after I paid for six months, upfront, and after spending hours setting up telling info about myself. Big disappointment. I am wanting to hear from someone in the company.
Also was wanting to try Enneagram work but it doesn't seem have a place to check that box feature and yet they advertise they do it. I bit confusing .

title: It‚Äôs my favorite app
review: I can talk with my therapist once per week, it is a perfect place where you can both take care of mental health, affordable and your therapist can send you text messages , v√≠deo or voice messages guidance for a better life.

title: Talkspace is awesome!
review: I have been used Talkspace for a year. It helped me going through my down time. Whenever I need help, my therapist Heather Hudson is always there taking care of me. I do appreciate I got this space to talk about my frustrations in my life.

title: This app adds more stress
review: Few therapists are available. Pointless to provide your preferences, matching results will be very limited and disappointing. They said they don‚Äôt have available therapists at this moment. Their customer service is surprisingly unhelpful. I wanted to like this app and super excited to try it out, but it turned out that it‚Äôs a big waste of time and it did add even more stress. Do not waste your time on this service.

title: Unresponsive
review:
As someone who struggles with bipolar disorder, I was looking forward to trying this out. My first therapist wasn‚Äôt a fit so I reached out to customer service to find a new one. They have been COMPLETELY unresponsive. It‚Äôs been a week and I still haven‚Äôt heard from anyone.
I am struggling and feel totally abandoned by this service. If I was in a more precarious mental state it would have been too late. 
I‚Äôve cancelled my membership and will be demanding a refund.

review: They lure you in by offering a ‚Äúgenerous discount‚Äù promising a back and forth with experienced therapists. I had the app for a week and received 3 responses from two different therapists over that period. When I contacted customer service, an automatic email was generated with quick links to cancellation and refunds. I guess a refund of $105 of the $140 is about the same price I‚Äôd pay for one session covered by insurance, but I still don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth it.

Forward facing camera would not engage during live video feature, has never occurred any other time on this phone with any other app.
Therapist old me that he doesn‚Äôt get the notifications that an appointment for video call. I didn‚Äôt know why he didn‚Äôt confirm the appointment so I scheduled another one, he says he never get the notifications or the assessments that are filled out, all he has access to are the chats.

None of which are even talking about what I explained was going on to make me feel so low. title: Terrible Responsiveness and Service
review: If you want help, look somewhere else.  If you choose this application you will end up with therapists that do not respond and/or do not care.  I was in a bad place when I decided to try this application and I am in a worse place afterward.  For a company that advertises a place where you can talk to a therapist, they do a terrible job providing therapists that will actually talk with you.

title: Epic Failure
review: The app is terrible, the customer service is worse, and when you (inevitably) realize that you‚Äôve wasted your money you cannot get a refund. I attempted to do a video call and it crashed about 8 minutes in. But, to Talkspace, I used one of my 30 minute sessions for it. It‚Äôs a complete joke and I‚Äôm in worse shape now than I was when I started the app. Don‚Äôt waste your time, energy, or money on this app. I wish I could rate it 0 stars.

title: Customer service is horrible
review: I‚Äôve been waiting for an answer to a simple insurance question for 7 days. It‚Äôs now interfering with my ability to talk to my therapist. Every time customer service writes me back it is not in answer to my question but instead generic responses. When I respond it takes another two days to get an email back that still has no answers. I‚Äôm not getting help so it‚Äôs useless. More stress than help.

I had a lot of trouble canceling my account. They offered me a refund but only a fraction of what I paid. I lost hundreds of dollars trying to get help. üôÅ

title: Waste of Money

The second one basically said, ‚ÄúThat is a tough problem. Have you ever tried just giving it time?‚Äù Ground breaking. This was an absolute letdown and waste on money. title: Highly recommend
review: Site is easy to use and therapist is extremely responsive.  If you have something you need help with, I would suggest trying this first.

title: Go see an in-person therapist
review: I tried Talkspace for a while and went through 2 therapists. They seemed like nice people but the delay in responses coupled with me feeling like I had to make the time to say something myself twice a day to justify the price just gave me more anxiety. I made more progress in one session with an in-person therapist than I did in a whole month of Talkspace.

Our Customer Support team is always happy to assist you with a therapist switch or any other accommodation they feel is necessary to help you along your therapy journey. If you change your mind, please reach out to them and they would be more than happy to assist you through the process.', 'modified': '2020-01-16T22:03:11Z'}

title: Platform has many issues
review: First therapist I had basically stood me up three times. After awhile decided I‚Äôd try it again and we did back and forth on scheduling for days, even though there is a booking area no one seems to use this. Has this problem with both therapists. The idea is great if they could get it together!

We look forward to helping you.', 'modified': '2021-07-04T22:15:21Z'}

title: Disgusted
review: I acknowledge that the therapist have their in person clientele. However, for this to be a mobile service there‚Äôs no reason why i should be waiting DAYS before getting a response. There‚Äôs no reason i should be getting an email from the system canceling a session because a counselor didn‚Äôt respond. I spent money just to never receive any service. I am disgusted and convinced this isn‚Äôt to help at all.
developerResponse: {'id': 22704803, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for taking the time to write this review. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com and someone from our team will gladly look into your experience and help right away. ', 'modified': '2021-05-09T16:54:54Z'}

title: Horrible app
review: I wish I had a way to give 0 stars. My experience has been awful, the communication from anyone on the app. They took $130 from me and have yet to respond to any of my support messages, it‚Äôs been 4 days. I‚Äôm so angry and frustrated that this is how I‚Äôve been treated. I suffer from severe anxiety and this is supposed to be the kind of place that doesn‚Äôt exacerbate those issues. I will never trust another app like this.
developerResponse: {'id': 19872587, 'body': "Hi there, we are deeply sorry your experience led you to feel so frustrated -- this is definitely not our goal and we understand that you're hoping for immediate support. We'd love to turn this around into a positive journey for you!", 'modified': '2020-12-19T22:24:53Z'}

title: A life saver
review: I started using Talkspace last July and that is the best thing I could have done. I have started to heal with the help of my wonderful therapist.  I don‚Äôt know where I would be without this app. Thank you x infinity.

title: Scam
review: I‚Äôd forgot I‚Äôd even subscribed to this app. That‚Äôs how long the responses took. Just another app on my phone I never clicked on. They‚Äôd been charging me $316 for three months (I should‚Äôve noticed) but also, I feel like if you have clients that aren‚Äôt responsive, shouldn‚Äôt you have to check on them? Instead of just continuously charging an account that is INACTIVE? This is very disappointing & I‚Äôd never refer this app to anyone in real need of help.

title: Inattentive and Barely There
review: My therapist RARELY replied and seemed to never provide any help, just sent blank worksheets and, when I sent them back completed, never bothered to read what I wrote. He never bothered to keep up with me, and i felt like i had to reintroduce myself and my desires every time we spoke. Don‚Äôt expect more than a sporadic message every couple of days and little personal attention. I feel cheated and robbed. DO NOT waste your money.
developerResponse: {'id': 17244906, 'body': 'Hi! Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are deeply sorry to hear that you had a disappointing experience, this is certainly never our intention. What you described is not our standard and something we take very seriously, we would love to help you further. Please send your account information over to us at Feedback@Talkspace.com, we are eager to make this right!', 'modified': '2020-08-12T19:18:03Z'}

title: Add a search feature
review: I‚Äôve use this app since December 2019 and it‚Äôs been great‚Äîmostly. Please add a search feature so the messages can be searched. It would be helpful to be able to search and revisit topics that have been discussed.
developerResponse: {'id': 17892459, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for writing this review and providing this feedback. We have passed along your feedback for review, we greatly appreciate it! If there is anything else we can help you with please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-09-15T14:25:36Z'}

title: The therapist to lean on
review: I love that I don‚Äôt have to wait an entire week or more to speak with my therapist and get things off my chest. They couldn‚Äôt have paired me so far with a better therapist. She is exactly what I need.
developerResponse: {'id': 21957366, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for providing this review. We are ecstatic to hear that you are having a positive experience with the platform and therapist!  \n', 'modified': '2021-03-30T20:48:39Z'}

title: Didn‚Äôt get much out of it
review: I feel this is very expensive for the little few sentences or a paragraph you may receive back.  It didn‚Äôt help me at all.  I know myself to take a walk and get fresh air.   I needed counseling for PTSD and grieving of several loved ones that passes unexpectedly.  So unless you just want a chat for 300$ a month I guess it‚Äôs worth it to someone.
developerResponse: {'id': 16028799, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for providing this feedback. We are very sorry to hear that you had a disappointing experience. It sounds like your therapist was not the right fit for your needs. If you ever decide to give us a second chance we would be happy to get you set up with someone new. ', 'modified': '2020-06-16T20:24:26Z'}

title: Talkspace got it right
review: I couldn‚Äôt have been luckier getting matched with my Talkspace therapist. The service is great. The app is well designed. It functions well. I am looking forward to getting re-started.

title: App is useless
review: The therapists in this app are decent. But the technology itself is horrible. None of the scheduling features work properly so you have to manage it manually. Also the customer support is completely useless. The people behind the company should be ashamed of themselves. Mental health services is so critical during Covid, and building a terrible technology for profit is just exploiting people who are in need. Be better.
developerResponse: {'id': 17679652, 'body': "Oh no! We're so sorry you're encountering this issue, our Support team is experiencing an extremely high volume of requests due to the pandemic, but we'd love to get to the bottom of this issue ASAP. Please reach out to Feedback@Talkspace.com and we'll be ready to find a resolution for you!", 'modified': '2020-09-03T21:25:08Z'}

title: Favors those willing to pay premium and not go through insurance
review: Although I think resources like this are needed, I feel that Talkspace clearly has their own agenda and looking to capitalize on this segment of the medical field. They advertise that they accept insurance but then the resources for those using insurance are limited. I was really hoping this would be a great option.
developerResponse: {'id': 21456052, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for taking the time to provide this review. We are very sorry to hear about your experience thus far and we understand your frustration. We certainly would love to look into your experience to see how we can best help you. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. We look forward to hearing from you! \n', 'modified': '2021-03-04T22:25:19Z'}

title: Hey, thanks for the warning NY TIMES
review: Few things in life are a complete waste of time and money. Matching agents are sales consultants, it‚Äôs like talking to a AOL instant messenger prototype. The counselor I had for 1 session was great. Talk space originally told me chat only sessions were not an option. Well, they are. Sign up if you want one response a week after sending a well tailored, concise thoughtful message to your provider. Read The NY Times article as well, it‚Äôs insightful.

title: Expensive & Slow Moving
review: This app is wayyyyyyyy to expensive to be so slow moving. I didn‚Äôt click with my assigned counselor and wasn‚Äôt even able to schedule a video session to try to remedy that. The app is too buggy for me to feel comfortable sharing my information. In their introduction videos they try to up sell you, which seems really tasteless in a ‚ÄúHow to Talk to Your Therapist‚Äù video.
developerResponse: {'id': 17960761, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for sharing here and we are sorry you haven't had a great experience with us so far. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com, we're eager to hear from you!", 'modified': '2020-09-18T20:25:13Z'}

title: Good therapist bad customer service
review:
So far the therapist is great but customer service won‚Äôt respond to a problem I‚Äôm having with billing.

Update: they got in touch today and the therapist is wonderful.

title: It‚Äôs better than nothing.
review: So far, it‚Äôs been only okay. Been on a few months but unfortunately it‚Äôs very impersonal and you‚Äôre just left in the lurch if you‚Äôre therapist goes on vacation or anything. But the fact that I can send a message any time to be read eventually is occasionally kinda nice. Like I said, better than nothing.

title: Horrible customer service
review: It‚Äôs easy to get a live person when they want you to sign up, but watch out after you give them a try. They billed me for a second month and I am unable to book any live sessions. I wrote to them weeks ago ... no response. No phone number. No live chat option. The therapist says he doesn‚Äôt handle that aspect. $400 gone and nothing to show for it.

title: Nobody Home
review:
This service is awful.  Have spent over two months trying to schedule and never ever gets accepted.  Then try to change providers but the software doesn‚Äôt work gets locked on a blank page.  Have opened three tickets and never had anyone respond or do anything for the tickets.

Nobody is behind this technology and I think they are trying to give us a breakdown.

title: Cancellation issues
review: I was on a 7 day free trial with TalkSpace and it ended up not being for me so I tried to cancel before my 7 days was up and it would not physically allow me to and I tried time and time again, still would not let me cancel but I was then charged the full $260 to my card. This is ridiculous, it shouldn‚Äôt be so hard to cancel and for a place that‚Äôs supposed to be help for mental health.

title: Therapists are WAY too busy.
review:
I had to wait days for a response to my messages and weeks to schedule sessions. It‚Äôs pretty clear that the providers are overwhelmed and have way too many clients. I felt like a number instead of a person.

Talkspace, please consider limiting the amount of clients your providers can have at one time. This was a very poor experience. I‚Äôm going back to an in-person therapist.

We look forward to helping you.', 'modified': '2021-07-05T19:03:10Z'}

title: Terrible Customer Service
review: The two therapists I signed up for either didn‚Äôt communicate by the time Talkspace said they would, and the second therapist was off starting the next day for 5 days. I got discouraged by the service and am trying to cancel my subscription for either a full or partial refund. Customer Service simply won‚Äôt respond to my request. Only an automated reply. Wild.

title: App works well, but there‚Äôs no one on the other side
review: I signed up for one month of services and a week in no one has replied to me either for therapy or for customer service to refund my payment since I‚Äôm receiving no services. Think twice before you sign up.  The app itself performs fine, but there is no one on the other side of the app to provide the services they claim to offer.

title: Bad model
review:
I signed up and could not even use the features paid for since the therapists are so overworked. My complimentary live video session will never be used because my therapist (and others I‚Äôve tried) have zero openings for multiple weeks. 
If you look up employee reviews on Glassdoor and such you can see that the person meant to be caring for your mental health is overworked and underpaid.

title: Stole My Money
review:
I signed up for a month at $250, took the test, and it connected me to a counselor. She took 3 days to respond (all the while I‚Äôd been paying). So, I switched to another counselor. She also took 3 days to respond. I told her it was unprofessional to take so long to respond to a patient mentally unstable at the time. She then refused to treat me, saying I needed in-person therapy. Ok.....

I emailed TalkSpace to get my money back.. silence. No response. 

Stay away!
developerResponse: {'id': 18435645, 'body': 'Hi there, we are so sorry to hear about your experience. This is certainly frustrating and we would love to help further. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-10-12T20:43:47Z'}

title: Does anyone actually work for this company?
review:
I‚Äôm not positive this isn‚Äôt a scam‚Äî I haven‚Äôt been able to get responses from anyone on this app. The therapist never contacted me, or responded when I contacted her‚Äî and customer support hasn‚Äôt gotten back with me either. 

I‚Äôve never felt emotional about about an app before, but paying a therapist not to talk to you after you‚Äôve explicitly reached out for help was actually hurtful.

title: Only one insurance provider
review: I was hoping this to have more then one insurance provider they take but in fact it‚Äôs only one premara of blue cross so I have to delete and uninstall because I can‚Äôt afford there prices being disabled! If they can add more insurance providers I bet this app can be more successful for people who want to do therapy on there own time in the luxury of their own home or when there on the go!

title: False advertising
review:
Therapists send you ONE message (often just a single sentence) once or twice a day. You do NOT have 24/7 access to anything or anyone except your own chat room. One of the therapists I talked to even said ‚ÄúTalkspace therapy is very slow and expensive.‚Äù I couldn‚Äôt agree more. I could have gotten the same quantity and quality of responses from people on Reddit for free. 
Don‚Äôt waste your time.

', 'modified': '2020-01-14T21:39:06Z'}

title: Avoid!!!
review: No bueno. The app didn‚Äôt display properly on my phone so I ended up booking an appointment that I thought was for 10am but ended up being 10pm! I could not reschedule and was charged. I have reached out several times to customer service but have received nothing but an automated email in reply. I feel taken advantage of and wasted my hard earned money. Not nice to do to people seeking help. Avoid avoid avoid.

title: NOT the way to get therapy
review:
Sending and receiving texts is no way to get therapy. The ‚Äòtherapist‚Äô I got felt as engaged as any customer service worker for a big tech company. 

Also, you‚Äôd think that a person of science could string a sentence together without multiple spelling errors, wouldn‚Äôt you? That might seem like a small matter, but for me, it really undercuts the qualifications of this so-called professional. I feel like I‚Äôm placing my trust (and my life) in the hands of a middling, though well meaning school girl.

This service isn‚Äôt exactly cheap, and swapping out therapists puts you back at square one, and with no better odds of getting someone better.

What a waste of time and money.

title: Would not recommend
review: Like other reviews are saying, the therapists are short with their replies and you‚Äôre lucky if you get a few replies. I know they are replying at their own time but I‚Äôm not paying over $200 a month for some random messages with the most generic short replies they could give.

review: This was supposed to be my first introduction to therapy. Eager and excited I awaited my therapists replies. After 5 DAYS of hearing nothing from her, I switched therapists. I waited a whole day and at 9:30PM she tells me there‚Äôs a glitch in the system and she can‚Äôt even have me as a client. But then no one works weekend. So then you make me wait until Monday to talk to anyone???? I am done. I have more anxiety than when I STARTED. Idiots.

review: This app was seriously disappointing but not because of the therapy treatments. I‚Äôve had an account since may which I‚Äôve tried cancelling several times but they would not let me. title: I think is a really cool idea
review: The concept is really cool but when it comes down to it you‚Äôre paying some really good money to speak to somebody and you‚Äôre not getting a response I feel like if you really think you need therapy it‚Äôs probably best that you go in person because you get the time and attention you need

review: It‚Äôs impossible to delete this app on your own. You have to contact customer service... but wait, even after you convince them to delete you.. they will continue sending you emails with  an ‚Äúunsubscribe‚Äù button at the bottom of these emails that... DOESN'T WORK. It‚Äôs fake. So they will continue sending you emails FOREVER. ..... I am so sick of them.

title: No Response
review: You would think that since they are dealing with your mental health that they would respond in a timely manner but no. Neither my therapist nor the customer service team got back to me for five days. It wasn‚Äôt until I reached out to their customer support via Twitter that I got a reply. I needed therapist to talk to immediately and I never got to talk to someone at all. Don‚Äôt waste your money on this.

title: The app, not the therapists, doesnt listen
review: We are a couple. Their couples function is unclear and confusing. We are international clients. We've been trying to find a therapist over a week who is legally allowed to help us. Talkspace's matching bot has no idea who's licensed to practice internationally, so it keeps matching us with therapists who cannot help us, and wasting everyone's time. No customer service line. Incredibly frustrating.

title: TERRIBLE APP
review: A terrible scam!! They want you to pay even if you don‚Äôt talk to a therapist! The therapist they gave me cancelled every session I tried to book and then they tried to charge me for more time so I can book another session and wouldn‚Äôt give me another therapist even though he would not talk to me! HORRIBLE SCAM! If you need help I suggest going somewhere else cause they won‚Äôt help you it‚Äôs all about the cash flow!

title: Too busy to care.
review: I finally gathers enough courage to try therapy only to find out that there are insufficient therapists to meet the demand. Every therapist I chose no longer accepted clients. I felt left out in the cold during the midst of a blizzard. And to add insult to injury, the customer service is relegated to an email black hole. If I was depressed before, imagine how I feel now... and $345 gone with nothing to show.

title: Waste of Money
review: Like I said, waste of money. I told my therapist I wanted a new one, but then I decided to give him chance to help me. He didn‚Äôt...in 5 days I‚Äôve gotten nowhere and it‚Äôs annoying. I just wanted some guidance on how to mange my temper but there was a lot of irrelevant conversations. It was dumb. And from what others had told me, they don‚Äôt reach out enough to pay this much amount of money. It‚Äôs dumb. I‚Äôm not happy.

title: Expensive
review: The layout looks nice and so do the features. I downloaded it because I really thought it could help me until I was told the cheapest plan is $260 a month. I rated 3 stars because I feel like I didn‚Äôt get a good chance to use the app fully due to the high cost.

We are always happy to look into what financial relief may be available to you. Please reach out to Feedback@talkspace.com so someone can further assist you. ', 'modified': '2020-03-26T20:44:34Z'}

title: So far not worth the time
review: They‚Äôve charged me my copay for services, my account says I have a session credit, yet the app wants me to pay another $65 to schedule anything on top of what they‚Äôve already charged and took from me and my insurance. Good luck getting tech support. It‚Äôs been over a week, two having the app and no one has yet to even acknowledge my issue. Stay away!
developerResponse: {'id': 16603917, 'body': 'Hi there, we are so sorry to hear that you were prompted to pay when you should not have been. We would love to help you further. If this has not already been resolved then please reach out to us again at Feedback@Talkspace.com so we can escalate your request. ', 'modified': '2020-07-13T20:43:18Z'}

title: Game changer for me!
review: It‚Äôs like having a diary that talks back and gives you solid advice and asks great questions. 10 out of 10 I actively recommend to people.

title: If you need help, stay away!
review:
I do not write reviews, however I needed to make an exception here. This service is dangerous if you expect mental health support and care. 

‚Ä¢ Slow responses
‚Ä¢ Very few actual psychologists, and if you can find one, no availability.
‚Ä¢ I would encourage anyone who needs to speak to someone find any other resource and to stay safe and healthy

In the end fancy Michael Phelps marketing is far from a way to care for patients needing and expecting support. 

When it‚Äôs a blurred line between being a customer and patient it is very concerning.

I expected this to be a healthy and viable alternative to traditional counseling and support, but was entirely wrong.
developerResponse: {'id': 18435564, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for providing this review. We appreciate your feedback immensely as we continue to learn and grow as a company. If there is anything we can do to further assist you please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. Our deepest apologies again for your disappointing experience and we are happy to do what we can to make it up to you. ', 'modified': '2020-10-12T20:36:15Z'}

title: Very Satisfied
review: I almost gave up on finding a therapist until I was recommended Nichole Cavallaro. She listens and makes you feel heard and appreciated. I am so glad I chose to give this a go! Highly recommend this app and this therapist.

title: Misleading
review: I signed up for a subscription that included video engagement with the counselor. The counselor they connected me with had no available video appointments. I reached out to customer service and got no response. I requested a refund and was sent to a refund wizard that said I wasn‚Äôt eligible for refund. I am out several hundred dollars after buying a subscription that wasn‚Äôt what it purported to be.
developerResponse: {'id': 21146295, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for taking the time to write this review based on your experience. We are very sorry. We would love to look into your experience further, if you don't mind please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. We are eager to make this up to you and provide the correct refund.", 'modified': '2021-02-18T18:25:39Z'}

title: So disappointed
review: I could not be more disappointed than I am with this. I really had high hopes for this but I went through multiple therapists and nobody timely responded and when I asked for a refund or a new therapist I was basically told to go pound sand. I have unused sessions that I paid for and they refuse to provide services because I complained about timelines of responses.

title: Awful
review: Really bad bug issues and problems with health insurance. My psychiatrist doesn‚Äôt care about my problems she just keeps telling me to take the meds she prescribed me. No way to get in contact with customer support other than email and they take months to reply which is very irresponsible for an app that supposedly advocates for mental health. If I could give 0 stars I would.

title: No response from therapist
review: I got no responses to my messages and she missed our first appointment. She also didn‚Äôt respond to my messages when the app guaranteed she would. I‚Äôm also unable to complete some of the documents on my iphone. The platform isn‚Äôt working for me and I‚Äôve revived no communication whatsoever. Huge amount of money down the drain. Talkspace, I need my money refunded ASAP!
developerResponse: {'id': 17405541, 'body': 'Hi there, we are truly sorry to hear this has been your experience so far and greatly appreciate you taking the time to write a review. The engagement you described does not sound up to our standard of quality. Your care is our top priority and if you would reach out to us at Feedback@Talkspace.com, we would love to see how we can make this right.', 'modified': '2020-08-20T19:57:17Z'}

title: Do not recommend using their services
review: Awful. No customer support. They are very misleading with the services they provide & they are not transparent with the cost. I tried many times to connect with customer service and no luck. I hope no one else who is looking for guidance has to go through the same experience.
developerResponse: {'id': 16730792, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for providing this review. We are very sorry to hear about any disappointment or frustration you are experiencing. Our Customer Support team is currently experiencing higher than usual ticket volumes, they are working very hard to answer every request as it comes in. We would be more than happy to escalate your request for you if you reach out at Feedback@Talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-07-19T20:44:44Z'}

title: No response from our therapist
review: I signed up for a couples therapy subscription and after being matched with a therapist, I was told he would reach out to us within 24 hours. We waited 11 days with no response from him. When we asked customer support to help us find a new provider, they didn‚Äôt have any and refused to take ownership for their unresponsive provider.
developerResponse: {'id': 22883781, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are so sorry to hear that you are having a frustrating experience with your therapist as this is not our standard. We would love to see what we can do to help. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. We look forward to helping you. \n', 'modified': '2021-05-18T22:47:53Z'}

title: Worth It
review: Even just having someone listen is worth it. Having a space where I can be free to talk about my feelings is invaluable to me.

title: Read this.
review: I don‚Äôt usually do reviews, however don‚Äôt waste money needlessly. It‚Äôs almost impossible to time when you will receive a response and since it‚Äôs expensive I would have expected a better turn around time. The whole experience was off somehow.
developerResponse: {'id': 23379119, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for providing this review. We are so sorry to hear that Talkspace did not meet your expectations. We can certainly understand your frustration and we would love to make this up to you if we can. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com and someone from our team would be happy to help further. ', 'modified': '2021-06-14T19:59:14Z'}

title: Impossible to start so far
review:
After almost two weeks, I‚Äôm still waiting to start my ‚Äòjourney‚Äô with this company. 

Unacceptable delays from both matching therapists and my actual therapist has been completely silent, missing response deadlines constantly. 

I have no evidence that there is actually a therapist at the other end of the message thread, because I‚Äôve literally never heard from them. 

Customer service is also silent. But of course, the credit card charges go through without delay! 

I know it‚Äôs a busy time in the industry, but my experience is that this company is unable to live up to its commitments to clients.
developerResponse: {'id': 21173076, 'body': "Hi there, we're so sorry to hear this has been your experience as we want you to be and feel supported from the start. If you have not already received a response from our support team, please let us know at Feedback@Talkspace.com. We're eager to ensure your concerns are addressed right away and make this up to you.", 'modified': '2021-02-19T21:26:46Z'}

title: Cool idea. Huge ripoff.
review: Apparently the scheduling app doesn‚Äôt work well for therapists so they don‚Äôt use it and scheduling the sessions you paid for is quite difficult. A journaling app would be about as helpful. Bummed I spent over $1000 for 3 months of service and made zero progress because I couldn‚Äôt get actual appointments.

title: Could work... someday.
review: It needs improvement. I tried to get matched with a therapist but if you don‚Äôt match right when you download it, you won‚Äôt be matched. I thought it would be better than better help because it seemed to have more professional concepts but I was wrong.

title: Terrible
review: My counselor completely abandoned my session after i paid my co pay in August . I notified customer service and they didn‚Äôt respond until October! I asked for a refund and they are pressuring me to change counselors and finish my session. Um no! The counselor abandoned the session and customer service was negligent. On top of that there is no number to call. I want my refund immediately.
developerResponse: {'id': 18435652, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for providing this review. We are very sorry to hear about your less than optimal experience. We can understand your frustration. We would love to have someone help you further with your refund request if this has not already been handled. Please send us an email at Feedback@Talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-10-12T20:44:38Z'}

title: Talkspace is great!!
review: I‚Äôve never done this before and I met my therapist today for the first time. Sere is awesome!!  Her personality is perfect and I know she will be easy to talk to. Wish I had done this sooner.
developerResponse: {'id': 21456024, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for providing this review. We are so happy to hear that you are having a positive experience with the platform. title: No support after being charged
review: I want my money back. Here people come for immediate support. Paid and two days gone no response. If this is their standard then i would not recommend this app to anyone. Now I need another therapy session for my charged money, I guess. I would be happy if i get my money back. However, poor experience so far.
developerResponse: {'id': 23783534, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for taking the time to provide this review. title: Waste of money
review: I loved the idea of talk space and the being able to text your therapist. However, it was a waste of money for me. My therapist would ‚Äúacknowledge‚Äù my responses but never get back to me. When I knew seeing a therapist face to face was the right option for me, the customer service would only give me half of what I paid. It‚Äôs a scam in my opinion.
developerResponse: {'id': 18435883, 'body': 'Hi there, we are so sorry to hear that you had a frustrating experience, what you described is certainly not the standard level of care we wish our therapists to provide. title: Bull$!!!!!!
review: I waited 9 hours to be given the quiz to match you to a therapist. I had a meltdown and felt like it was time to fix me and get back on track. And for what? These ppl seem to lack any sense of urgency. Mental health needs to be taken more seriously by developers. Our lives are in your hands. I assume customer support won‚Äôt respond so I‚Äôm reporting the charge as fraud.

title: Like this a lot
review: I‚Äôm kinda new to the app but I‚Äôve never been in therapy before and so far everything‚Äôs been very positive. My therapist is seemingly really nice and supportive.

title: Don‚Äôt download this app
review: Paid $260 to try and get set up. My therapist cancelled on me twice. Tried to get in touch with customer service, didn‚Äôt hear back for a week. Really want a refund but as for therapy you might as well go to a canyon and throw money into it and scream your problems into the void. Completely terrible app and I honestly feel like they stole $260 from me
developerResponse: {'id': 21146568, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are so sorry to hear that you are having a frustrating experience with your therapist. ', 'modified': '2021-02-18T18:37:28Z'}

title: Hard pass.
review: This is so impersonal.  The way it works is so weird.  I don‚Äôt want to drag things out throughout days and weeks.   Just set up a slot once a week and hash things out.  This format would take 100x longer than just setting aside an hour.   This platform is not for me and I doubt it‚Äôs for you but good luck all.

title: Bad experience
review:
The consultant is replying like an automated bot, she will work on marketing and telling you to buy their plans while you are writing what your issue is.

The idea is supposed to be nice but the way the consultants talk to you, you'll say no way they are real doctors, no way they care about what you are telling them expect when you are buying their stuff.
developerResponse: {'id': 14192948, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for providing this review. My apologies for any frustration you may be experiencing upon signing up. We would love to further assist you with any issues you are having, please reach out to Feedback@talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-03-23T15:53:19Z'}

title: Awaiting help is long
review: Depending on which matching person you get, your help varies.  Some want to show possible matches some just are in it to get you to sign up and commit.  It is very frustrating for someone who is a first timer to the process.

title: No Response
review: Downloaded this app Wednesday and messaged back & forth with the matching agent when I had time. Sent my last message Wednesday around 6. title: I do not recommend
review: They gave me a promotion to pay less for first time and they ended up charging me in full, I emailed and a few weeks later they responded saying ‚Äúwe‚Äôre sorry...‚Äù but didn‚Äôt solve any problem or mentioning it also they didn‚Äôt refund me the extra charges.

title: Love it
review: I absolutely love my therapist and have come along so far!!! I don‚Äôt have 1 bad thing to say about Talkspace or my therapist! Thank you! A+++! Therapy never helped me, but my therapist on here HAS and DOES!

title: Lazy online therapists
review:
Leticia messaged me back only once out of 4 days i‚Äôve been messaging her. This whole thing is a scam and is $360 for 4 weeks definitely not worth it. I get more comforts listening to podcasts then talking to these lazy ‚Äútherapist‚Äù they only seem to care about getting money in their pocket
I regret so much trying this 4 week thing
developerResponse: {'id': 16267389, 'body': 'Oh no! This is certainly not our standard. We can understand your frustration here, we would be very happy to make it right. Please reach out to us at Feedback@talkspace.com so we can further assist. ', 'modified': '2020-06-28T19:52:57Z'}

title: Rejection?
review:
I understand that this is a counseling app for people who really need it.

Why can‚Äôt eleven or twelve year olds use this?? They may really need it, and then you reject them?

title: I Tried but No
review: I wanted to give this a shot since I didn‚Äôt want to do Zoom therapy sessions, but it‚Äôs just not good. I didn‚Äôt feel like the ‚Äúproviders‚Äù (therapists) I spoke to really grasped what I was saying, it as more ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry you feel that way‚Äù and shoo‚Äôing me on my way. title: Do what is right for you
review: A great service in theory but not going to be the right fit for everyone. Unfortunately a service like this will be held to a higher standard because of the service they provide. review: I‚Äôve been through two therapists with TalkSpace and I haven‚Äôt quite seen the value in this yet, unfortunately. From my experience, they‚Äôve been unresponsive and the majority of what they‚Äôve shared with me is general information. I really wish this would have worked.

review: This app has literally changed me life. I have the best therapist in the world and I couldn‚Äôt have been more great  grateful for this.

title: Response Time
review: Maybe my expectations were to high. I started this process on Sunday night. Took 4 hours to match me with a therapist. Started the intake process this am at 0:930. Was first unable to get acknowledgment that text was received. Over an hour later I got a text I would hear from her by 8 pm tonight. I was really hoping this could work for me.

title: Extremely Disappointing
review: It seems that my first therapist didn‚Äôt know what to say to me. Awkward pauses during our video session and recommended I Google tools vs talking me through them. Switched therapists and not receiving a response in 5 days is extremely disappointing. I had multiple video sessions that went to waste. Def won‚Äôt continue.

title: I‚Äôm hesitant to trust my medical info to this
review: Starting with the on boarding loop that it sends you on every time you try to change a setting, and ending with the fact that I wasn‚Äôt able to get a session and my provider get paid for the last 2 weeks, even though my insurance says I‚Äôm covered... This app is an encyclopedia of bugs.

title: Completely dissatisfied
review: This service is sub par and highway robbery. I was billed for second month $396 in advance despite pressing end therapy numerous times. One month of service wasn‚Äôt even worth it. title: Don‚Äôt recommend!
review:
The app is buggy. My provider and I have both sitting in the app waiting to be connected but it never happened. They don‚Äôt have actually that many therapists available and for most part it seems Talkspace is therapists‚Äô side job.

Edit: I contacted their support more than a week ago and nobody got back to me. What a joke.
developerResponse: {'id': 16569171, 'body': 'Oh no! We are sorry to hear that you were having some issues with the app, we can understand your frustration. title: This costs money
review:
The lowest cost on this app is $65 per week. I do not know of anyone without insurance, with or without unemployment would afford this. Why is this being advertised so heavily as an affordable / accessible way to access therapy? 

Other apps indicate if there are purchase required fo use the app on the App Store and there is no such a warning on this app. 

I am so lost.

title: No customer support
review: The only way to contact customer support is by creating an in-app ticket. I created one in September and followed up twice to no response. They sent out a mass email on Monday saying to follow up if my ticket still hadn‚Äôt been resolved, which I did. Guess what‚Äîno response!

review: Signed up my teenage daughter to get help during the pandemic. Therapist took up to 24 hours to reply via text and didn‚Äôt at all connect with her. Kids need a way quicker reply time. By the time we figured out it wasn‚Äôt working and she wasn‚Äôt using it we had been charged $455.  Joke.

title: Horrible app
review: Find yourself a therapist locally. The therapists who you are matched with are often out of state and will drop you if they feel like it. Customer support was no help and has yet to answer any of my requests since coincidentally this sudden change happened the day after my subscription renewed. Good luck getting any help.
developerResponse: {'id': 19872463, 'body': "Hi there, our sincere apologies for the trouble finding a provider. For licensure requirements, it's generally necessary for providers to work with clients in the same state. You should be receiving provider matches based on the state you select so if that has not been the case, we're eager to look into this right away and help you find an appropriate match. review: I‚Äôm so glad I chose to get better using TalkSpace. So convenient and less pressure than regular talk therapy.

title: At bestUseless, at wort harmful
review: Therapy has the ability to help or harm. This is scientifically proven. 15 days in without a single acknowledgement of the vast information I provided , as requested. I mean how hard is it to write back: ‚Äògee, that sounds really tough‚Äô. That‚Äôs supposed to be basic human compassion known by many that don‚Äôt even possess a Master‚Äôs Degree.

title: Horrible customer service
review: Very deceiving in how they will charge your card. Took $750 out of my account and will not respond to my emails and phone calls. I‚Äôll be reporting this app for fraud. This app was supposed to help my anxiety and it has only made it go through the roof. Thanks for nothing!

We would love to help with your request ASAP, please send your account information over to us at Feedback@Talkspace.com. We look forward to making this right! ', 'modified': '2020-09-02T19:57:04Z'}

title: Great concept, doesn‚Äôt work
review:
They ask you to fill out an intake form to share with your therapist, okay... that makes sense. 

The therapist finally responds with the same questions from the intake form and send you some links to articles on dealing with anxiety. That‚Äôs lame. 

You respond, but it will take at least another day to hear back from the therapist. 

What is this? It‚Äôs like playing chess by mail. What is the point of having a therapist that doesn‚Äôt set a time to chat with you and just sends lame articles. Avoid this app.

title: Basically a scam
review:
Don‚Äôt do this unless you want short generic responses you could have read in a self help book sent to you twice a day. 

There is no quality control to the responses the therapists give and because you are not with them in person they can just ignore you. The ‚Äúguaranteed response times‚Äù are basically optional.

The supposed algorithm to match you with someone who specializes in your condition doesn‚Äôt really seem to be working.

PS most of these reviews are fake, read all about it in the nytimes

title: Once good service now scammy

Therapists don‚Äôt respond, the therapist I got matched up with has no availability and their calendar was always ‚Äúbooked up, check again later.‚Äù Literally cannot get an appointment with someone but they are still happy to charge my money.

title: Predatory
review:
If you subscribe, the only way to apply insurance is through a second subscription.

They don‚Äôt use standard IAP; you have to given them your card, so you‚Äôre not protected by Apple‚Äôs normal App Store protections.

In order to cancel subscriptions you need to click through seven different ‚Äúplease don‚Äôt unsubscribe‚Äù screens.

They use weasly language, instead of ‚Äúyour insurance isn‚Äôt supported‚Äù it‚Äôs ‚Äúyou get a limited time discount!‚Äù

I don‚Äôt recommend unless it‚Äôs your only option.

title: I was excited to get started but so far, disappointed
review:
I‚Äôve been interested in using Talkspace for some time now. Finally, my moment came when receiving an email from my company about having 3 months free so I decided to take the plunge. I‚Äôve seen therapists before but this would be the first I‚Äôve done it through an app so I was extremely excited to see how I could get started. For starters, I don‚Äôt necessarily find the app to be user friendly. It isn‚Äôt the easiest to navigate if you want to figure out if you‚Äôve scheduled any appointments or just want to poke around in settings. From there, the match coach isn‚Äôt much help. You‚Äôre given some options after taking a short assessment, but if you don‚Äôt find anyone you‚Äôd feel you can connect with, you can only see new matches two additional times before having to start the quiz over, Input all of your information all over again just to receive the same options as before. 

You can contact their CX team via the app which is great and after taking a loon I figured it would be a live chat but I shortly received an email notification stating I‚Äôd be contacted shortly. Not too sure why it would be set up as a chat interface if it isn‚Äôt that. I still haven‚Äôt received any information about any of the therapist I thought I scheduled (selected a therapist, date, time and all), no contact back from the matching coach, or from the CX team. Honestly, you‚Äôd probably be better off going to psychology today where there are better filters and just emailing a therapist yourself.

title: Good concept, bad execution
review:
The concept of online therapy sounds great and convenient, but it‚Äôs not very personable.
This app might be good for someone working through a temporary issue, but for anyone with chronic mental health issues I‚Äôd advise you steer clear. 
The process to match up with a therapist was easy to navigate and user friendly, however, after getting matched up with a therapist it was like they weren‚Äôt even reading what I was writing to them. They‚Äôd asked if I had been in therapy before after I had already stated that. Then they asked what brought me to talk space after I had literally just finished explaining myself. After that I was directed to the talkspace bookshelf and wasn‚Äôt really sure where to go from there. I was lucky to get a sentence or two a day from my therapist in response to paragraphs. I was also supposed to get a complimentary video chat that was never initiated. My therapist stopped checking in with me and I considered getting another,  but I figured it was better to cancel before the month was up before losing out on more money. With the pandemic going on I figured this was the only way to get counseling, but I‚Äôd rather wait until things open back up since this was more expensive and less convenient than actual in person therapy. 
If you just wanted someone to talk to through a temporary issue, go for it, but if you have severe depression, anxiety, or addiction, save your money. There‚Äôs peer counseling apps and sites that are much more helpful than this service.
developerResponse: {'id': 16028820, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for providing this review. We are very sorry to hear about your disappointing experience, we can understand your frustration. This is definitely not our standard and we would love to look into this further with our clinical quality team. Please reach out to us at Feedback@talkspace.com. ', 'modified': '2020-06-16T20:27:54Z'}

title: Absolutely horrible
review: Due to covid I was trying to do online therapy, but I have a particular disorder I need a therapist to have worked with before in order to help me. I was told it would be possible to find someone fit to me but that was not the case at all. The only specification I had was the person had to have worked with this disorder before, yet I was suggested what seemed like random people and none of them had worked with anything even close to what I was looking for. I was suggested a therapist that worked with male issues and I am a female, and one that worked with porn addiction which is no where even NEAR the other neurological disorder I have. When I asked if there was a way my marcher could recommend me more specific options she simply didn‚Äôt respond. I went through multiple pages of therapists and they got more and more random as I went on. The only person that could help me was my matches that had read my message and not responded for over 24 hours. I eventually asked again if there was a way she could help me refine the results and yet again she didn‚Äôt respond, the bare minimum she could have said was that it‚Äôs too specific for her to know. But radio silence from someone who is supposed to be a professional helping me is unacceptable. There is also no other way to find a therapist, and there is no way to switch even if they are not helping or responding at all. Eventually when I asked how to get a refund after her not responding to my past 2 messages asking for help she responded immediately but did not address anything from my 2 messages before that one. My experience was horrible and so frustrating because they obviously did not care about helping me find someone that actually fits my needs.

title: Hopes dashed
review:
I had high hopes for this app , do yourself a favor save your money and go to real therapy sessions. I‚Äôm aware that they have placed impossible expectations and pressure on their therapists , that this is just a side hustle with too many rules and a lot of them are overbooked . You‚Äôll get 2-3 replies a day,  all of them using a limited amount of words because talkspace has some rule about that . I know for a fact that my therapist hasn‚Äôt been reading what I have been writing even though I have tried to be brief out of consideration. My therapist have asked me questions that I just answered in the previous text smh , happened twice in one day and that is when I decided that I was done with this . Having used this app left me feeling sad and disappointed at the fact that they capitalize on something as serious as mental health , everyone is losing on this game except for talkspace

Update : this service is terrible, the therapist just ask a bunch of questions and doesn‚Äôt give you any insight or tips to improve the situation . I finished the twelve weeks and the therapist just mentioned that my paid sessions were almost up , asked me two more questions , I replied and after that nothing else was said . The therapist didn‚Äôt even read the message .... you would think that if my time was almost up , there would be some type of closure /final suggestion to improve what led me to seek therapy . You are just going to be left in the air even though the therapist knows that your time in almost up and he/she needs to wrap it off 

I guess they want you to pay more to get a final insight / closure to your therapy smh

title: Definitely not worth it/made my anxiety/depression worse.
review: I decided to get help with with some of my emotional issues. I was hoping to be able to just talk to a professional over the phone on my way home from work some days. This app is definitely not that. I didn‚Äôt really understand until I got into it but the cheapest plan they offer is $65 per week. This only includes two text messages a day from a therapist. So $260 a month to get 2 replies a day. There is also no guarantee that these replies are going to be at all helpful. I have heard maybe one piece of useful advice from a therapist on this app. I feel like I can pour my heart out to a therapist and then 4 days later(due to the therapist you choose only working a few days a week) I might get a message that says something vague like ‚Äúwhat do you think makes you feel that way?‚Äù I don‚Äôt see how this app is helpful to anyone with a real issue with depression or that genuinely needs a person to talk to. The only way to get more interaction is to upgrade to their higher plans. Those can cost up to 400/ month. So then you basically get a few live video chats for a car payment. I  don‚Äôt know how expensive normal therapy is, however I feel I could pay anyone $400 per month and get more useful help than I have gotten from this app. I changed therapists because of some of the issues I have stated, and since I changed therapists on Friday I have gotten 1 message from her. She is apparently off on weekends, but here it is, 5pm on a Monday and still no sign of life that anyone is going to try and give me any kind of help. Save your money, all of this has stressed me out and made me even more anxious waiting on the possible chance someone will respond to any one of my questions.
